thread.title: Burkina Faso 2-0 Tunisia: Stallions book their place in AFCON semi-finals after late double
thread.title_full: Burkina Faso 2-0 Tunisia: Stallions book their place in AFCON semi-finals after late double

author: Arash Hekmat
title: Burkina Faso 2-0 Tunisia: Stallions book their place in AFCON semi-finals after late double
text:
Prejuce Nakoulma celebrates after scoring Burkina Faso's second (Photo: AFP) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
Burkina Faso booked their passage into the semi-finals of the Africa Cup of Nations , scoring two late goals to overcome Tunisia at the Stade d'Angondje in Liberville. 
The Stallions may have considered themselves fortunate to top Group A after drawing their first two games and were underdogs coming into this game, but they are beginning to look like genuine challengers. 
Paulo Jorge Rebelo Duarte's side will face their toughest test yet in the semi-finals though, with either Morocco or Egypt set to be their next opponents. Aristide Bance made a dramatic impact from the bench, scoring the game's opening goal (Photo: AFP) His converted free-kick came just minutes after his introduction (Photo: AFP) Read More AFCON 2017 fixtures and results: Schedule and scores from the Africa Cup of Nations 
But for the moment, the team can revel in a dramatic late victory over the Eagles of Carthage, thanks to substitute Aristide Bance's drilled free-kick in the 82nd minute. 
Prejuce Nakoulma put the icing on the cake three minutes later after Tunisia were caught out while searching for a late equaliser. 
The striker, who is currently without a club since leaving Turkish outfit Kayserispor earlier this year, rounded Tunisia keeper Aymen Mathlouthi 35 yards from his goal, before driving into the penalty area and firing the ball into the empty net. Tunisia's tournament is now finished, while the Stallions will face Egypt or Morocco in the semis (Photo: REUTERS) Burkina Faso have improved as the tournament has progressed (Photo: AFP) Burkina Faso's AFCON 2017
